<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Melixie](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1322)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Melixies are hyperactive insect sprites with legendary sweet tooths, capable of drinking down honey, nectar, sugar, and other sweets in alarming quantities. Melixies take the insectile wings common among winged fey and up the ante with antennae and additional insect features, typically shared with bees but sometimes with butterflies, moths, ladybugs, or other beetles. Melixies live in a pattern of rapid consumption of sweets, incredible productivity in tasks of all sorts, and then a crash to sleep it all off and start again. Melixies in their productive state even engage happily in large-scale repetitive tasks that most sprites find dreadfully dull. In their spare time, melixies love to dance, and some of them learn a dancelike sign language called Melisylvan, allowing them to communicate a full range of information through movement. 

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 14

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 12

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 9
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 0">[Melixie](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1322)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="CN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Tiny" />
<trait label="Fey" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=69" />
<trait label="Sprite" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=238" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 254</row>

**Perception** +4; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10); speak with arthropods

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +6, [Confectionery Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +6, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +6, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +6

<row gap="medium">
**Str** -1

**Dex** +4

**Con** +2

**Int** +2

**Wis** +0

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Speak with Arthropods** A melixie can communicate with arthropods, such as insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals. They can use [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on arthropods and [Request](/Actions.aspx?ID=51) things from arthropods.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 16 

**Fort** +6 

**Ref** +8 

**Will** +4 

</row>

**HP** 17

**Weaknesses**
[cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 2

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 10 feet, fly 40 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
stinger +8 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 1d6–1 bludgeoning damage

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
sting shot +8 ([Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 1d6 poison

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 17
- **Cantrips (1st)**
[Dancing Lights](/Spells.aspx?ID=58), [Ghost Sound](/Spells.aspx?ID=132)
- **1st**
[Ant Haul](/Spells.aspx?ID=13)

**Sugar Rush** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) The melixie consumes a large quantity of sugar, honey, nectar, or similar sweets and goes into a frenzied state. The melixie immediately Strides or Flies. For the next 1d4+1 rounds, the melixie is [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32), and can use the additional action only to Stride or Fly. As soon as the rush ends, the melixie is [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15) for 1 minute.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Minature Desserts</title>

While most melixies gobble up any sweets they find, those who can resist eating the raw ingredients for long enough learn to use them create incredibly small desserts in a startling variety of styles and flavors. Some members of larger ancestries even enjoy the way that a tray of melixie desserts allows them to experience so many different flavors before becoming full.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-95" />
name: Melixie
